name: Coachman's Inn

reviews.text: We had two rooms for three nights at The Coachman’s Inn during May 2007. The rooms were immaculately clean and very spacious.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a number of nice touches such as spa baths (in some rooms), microwaves (complete with some popcorn!) and a fridge.
reviews.title: Great Room

reviews.text: All of the shops and restaurants in Carmel are in easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Coachmans

likes.disliked: — noise from street and continental breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative about the Inn is the parking - this is limited (not enough for each room to have a space).
reviews.title: A passing Coachman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly return again.
reviews.title: A fine stay

reviews.text: We stayed in this inn for 1 night while on a trip to celebrate our anniversary. The location is excellent, as it is within walking distance of most of the downtown businesses. Also, the rooms are a nice size, with VERY comfortable beds. However, there are a few negatives as well. First, they deliver "breakfast" in a bucket to your door. You get a TINY carton of juice, an apple, and a DISGUSTING pastry or muffin. These are like the kind that you get in a 20 pack at Costco. Defintely plan on making other breakfast arrangements. Also, our confirmation letter stated that we had a jacuzzi bathtub in our king room. This did not exist and was a big letdown. Finally, we booked this hotel through a Travelzoo special and received a really good rate. There is no way that I would pay the rate listed for this inn, as there are much nicer $200+ inns in the area. Get a deal or stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: probably overpriced
Transported in time
reviews.text: We've been to Carmel many times, but never before with our canine companion. I found the Coachman's Inn in a guide book for dog lovers. Wow, was it ever nice. Its architecture and furnishings made us feel as though we'd been transported back to Tudor England. The office staff was friendly. We would recommend the Inn to all canine companions. (But I'd love to stay here even if we hadn't brought our dog, Sparky.) It was an easy walk to the shopping areas and to all the restaurants that would let Sparky eat with us on the outside patios. The evening cookies were scrumptious, and the morning continental breakfast (which was brought to us in a champagne bucket) was filling enough to tide us over until we ate an early lunch. It's also a block away from a nice store and deli, so you could save money by putting some sandwich fixings in the room refrigerator. The room was clean, quiet and spacious and the bed super comfortable. The amenities were presented in a pleasant manner. However, the parking spaces are a bit narrow, so if you have a choice between taking a truck and a car, opt for the car. Every room was decorated for the holidays with a wreath on each door and a small Christmas tree in each room. We can hardly wait to go back again.

For the most part, we enjoyed our stay at the Coachman's inn. The location is good--it's in the business district, less than 2 blocks from Ocean Avenue. The desk staff was polite and knowledgable. The day clerk recommended a very good restaurant for us. The furnishings were nice--the carpet soft, the bedding pleasant, etc. They also have a video library, which was a good touch.
reviews.title: Good, but...

reviews.text: However, there were some things that were annoying.
reviews.title: coachman's inn was great

reviews.text: 1) There isn't enough parking when the Inn is full. We ended up parked on the street, and most of Carmel has 90 minute parking limits starting at 8a every day. We're pretty lazy people when we're on vacation, so having to remember to move the car at 9:30 was slightly irritating.
reviews.title: So Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just were not sure where to stay, I contacted Ellent at NYCMove and she suggested this adorable place. It had the true Carmel charm, it was in a great location and very very clean and they bring a cute little breakfast to your room, try and get a fireplace it adds the Carmel feeling. The hotels here are NOT super luxury they are quaint and adorable, We will go back to this place for sure again, it was just the most relaxing 4days. Carmel is a wonderful time to watch the world go bye and unwind...
reviews.title: Excellent and Charming

likes.liked: — it blended in with the charm of Carmel

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 3 nights mid-May 2006. We paid 155/night, inn told us we were given a 3 night stay special. Compared to other places I priced in the area, I was pleased with the price. The room was large with a fireplace, king bed and a twin bed, which we used to keep our luggage on. This was our last few days on the west coast after a 2 week trip so it was wonderful to stay in such a lovely, homey, comfortable environment. I loved the exterior of this place with the cobblestone, hanging plants, wrought iron chairs, it was all just lovely. I felt I had been transported to a small European inn. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room has a bathroom with all the amenities, wi-fi, microwave with popcorn, fridge, fireplace, everything was great. Inn is centrally located, easy to walk anywhere in central Carmel. The parking spaces are small.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn - noise is an issue - select room carefully

reviews.text: We were in room 303 so our windows faced out to San Carlos. The room was stuffy so we kept the windows open as much as possible. We tried to keep open the first night but the noise on the street, even in quiet Carmel, was too much. Everyone's voices traveled right up to our windows. I can't imagine the people in room 203 were able to open their windows at all since they were right at street level. The room did not have any sort of fan and it was humid, warm, stuffy at times. I think a ceiling fan would have prevented some of the need to open the window.
reviews.title: Like staying with Hansel & Gretel

reviews.text: The walls are thin. I could hear people talking in the next room.The worst was closing the doors on rooms on either side of us. Especially room 304. Everytime the door was closed it sounded like it was being slammed, it would make our door rattle. And it wasn't just the people, the people who were there the first night checked out the next morning and more people moved in who still closed the door loudly. Room 302 wasn't as bad but still loud. And if anyone stood outside our room and talked, we could hear every word. I am a very heavy sleeper but I was woken repeatedly by doors and conversation from outside the windows and in the hall.
reviews.title: Charming little inn
Fabulous time at this cute little inn
reviews.text: I so enjoyed this place, it is so lovely, but would be hesitant to stay here again unless in the dead of winter, during the week, when I know I would get some rest and quiet. I would try for a third floor room on the middle "wing" where the windows open to the courtyard. Maybe even a corner room where the room is tucked away from the door and other doors closing wouldn't be as loud. I would never stay on the 1st floor. Unless saying on Mission it is underground with just the one side facing the parking lot exposed.
We stayed here two nights at 303 dollars pr. night.
reviews.title: Not worth 300 dollars - noisy and pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no elevator, so we had to carry all our luggage up some very steep stairs to the top floor.
reviews.title: Very Impressed with this hotel

likes.liked: — They were pet friendly and the rooms were beautiful and charming
likes.disliked: — They didn't have an area to take the dogs out to potty, had to walk down the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was okay, very "cute" interior with "antiques", fake fireplace and "european" look. Refrigator. No pool, no cable. 2 queens side by side (we were 4 people). DVD "library" included.
reviews.title: Great Value
Great value in Carmel
reviews.text: Very noisy at night, noise from the nearby street as well as from the other hotel guests - a lot of very noisy motorcyclists stayed here. Thank god finally someone called the cops and two police cars arrived and told the bikers to keep it down. Didn´t get much sleep that night. We felt unsafe, reception closed at 10 pm, no staff around.
"Muffin breakfast" a joke. Consisted of two small cakes, an apple and a glass of orange juice. More like a snack.
reviews.title: Lovely but a bit noisy at night

description: This newly renovated Carmel by the sea Inn features 30 uniquely decorated and spacious rooms that provide all of the charm and ambiance of an inn with the services of a hotel. Starting with the complimentary breakfast, you will certainly enjoy all the great amenities as you visit the Sunset Center, Carmel Beach, Carmel shops, restaurants and art galleries of this gorgeous seaside town.
